com.netcracker.edu.salinskii.archiver

Class Archiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netcracker.edu.salinskii.archiver.Archiver

  • public class Archiver
extends java.lang.Object
    This class should be used for *.zip files manipulations. With help of it you could create new archives, add some information to the existing or just uncompress some of them. Created by Alimantu on 22/11/15.
    Author:
    Alimantu

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int BUFF_SIZE
      This field is sets the size of the used buffer for files manipulation operations.
      private java.lang.String DEFAULT_COMMENT
      This constant will be used for setting the default comment during creation of the archives if user didn't like to specify them himself.

      Archiver()

      • checkSystemFiles

        private boolean checkSystemFiles(java.lang.String fileName)
        Simple checker for system files. (Currently specified only for OS X)
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the checked file.
        Returns:
        true if checked file is system file false otherwise.

        names - list of the files, that are currently in ZipOutputStream.

                                    java.lang.String... paths)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Simplification of the method addFilesToArchive(String, String, String...) uses DEFAULT_COMMENT as comment.
        Parameters:
        archivePath - path of the output archive file.
        paths - varargs of the paths of the files should be added to the archive.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if any of the parameters equals to null.

      • addFilesToArchive

        public void addFilesToArchive(java.lang.String archivePath,
                              java.lang.String comment,
                              java.lang.String... paths)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Add to the existing, or creates new archive and add new files to it.
        Parameters:
        archivePath - path of the output archive file.
        comment - comment, that should be added to the resulting zip file.
        paths - varargs of the paths of the files should be added to the archive.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if any of the parameters equals to null.

      • copyArchive

        private java.util.zip.ZipOutputStream copyArchive(java.io.File from,
                                                  java.util.Set<java.lang.String> names)
                                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                                  java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Simplification of the copyArchive(File, Set, String) method uses DEFAULT_COMMENT as comment.
        Parameters:
        from - input file should to be copied.
        names - Set with all previous used names, that would be added with names of the new added files during the work of this method.
        Returns:
        ZipOutputStream with all files copied from the input File.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there are some troubles during usage of the I/O streams.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if any of the arguments is equal to null.

      • copyArchive

        private java.util.zip.ZipOutputStream copyArchive(java.io.File from,
                                                  java.lang.String comment)
                                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                                  java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Simplification of the copyArchive(File, Set, String) for situations when we don't need names of the files inside the archive.
        Parameters:
        from - input file should to be copied.
        comment - comment, that should be added to the archive.
        Returns:
        ZipOutputStream with all files copied from the input File.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there are some troubles during usage of the I/O streams.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if any of the arguments is equal to null.

      • copyArchive

        private java.util.zip.ZipOutputStream copyArchive(java.io.File from,
                                                  java.util.Set<java.lang.String> names,
                                                  java.lang.String comment)
                                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                                  java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Copies File to the ZipOutputStream, adding the used names to the names Set and sets the comment of the stream to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        from - input file should to be copied.
        names - Set with all previous used names, that would be added with names of the new added files during the work of this method.
        comment - comment, that should be added to the archive.
        Returns:
        ZipOutputStream with all files copied from the input File.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there are some troubles during usage of the I/O streams.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if any of the arguments is equal to null.

      • addFilesToArchive

        public void addFilesToArchive(java.io.File archive,
                              java.lang.String comment,
                              java.io.File... files)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Add files to the existing archive, or creates new one with them.
        Parameters:
        archive - archive File, that should be used for adding new files.
        comment - comment, that should be added to the archive.
        files - files, that should be compressed and added to the specified archive file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if any of the arguments is equal to null.

        Parameters:
        zipOutputStream - stream for adding new entry.
        entry - added enrty.
        zipInputStream - input stream with bytes of the specified entry.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there are some troubles during work with I/O streams.

      • setComment

        public void setComment(java.lang.String archiveName,
                       java.lang.String comment)
        Sets the comment of the existing archive specified by archiveName to the given comment. Could have some troubles when used in the same place with other methods of the class with the same archive file.
        Parameters:
        archiveName - name of the destination archive.
        comment - comment should be set.

      • setComment

        public void setComment(java.io.File archive,
                       java.lang.String comment)
        Sets the comment of the existing archive to the given comment. Could have some troubles when used in the same place with other methods of the class with the same archive file.
        Parameters:
        archive - destination archive.
        comment - comment should be set.

      • getComment

        public java.lang.String getComment(java.lang.String archiveName)
        Simple getter of the comment from the archive specified by archiveName.
        Parameters:
        archiveName - name of the archive for getting comment.
        Returns:
        String value of the comment of the archive if it's exists.
